A single universal language could facilitate global communication and understanding, leading to more efficient and effective international diplomacy and cooperation. This could lead to the resolution of conflicts and the promotion of peace and stability across the world.

A single universal language could also help to promote cultural exchange and understanding, as people from different countries would be able to communicate more easily and share their cultures with one another.

A single universal language could also help to reduce the cost of international business and trade, as businesses would not need to invest in language translation services and employees would not need to learn multiple languages.
A single universal language could also help to promote global education and learning, as students would be able to access educational materials and resources from around the world more easily.
A single universal language could also help to promote global tourism, as tourists would be able to communicate more easily with locals and navigate foreign environments more easily.
